transcript:
amid these cares her anxiety about Pierre was evident. She kept an anxious watch on him when he approached the group round Morte- mart to listen to what was being said there, and again when he passed to another group whose center was the abbe*. 
Pierre had been educated abroad, and this reception at Anna Pavlovna's was the first he had attended in Russia. He knew that all the intellectual lights of Petersburg were gathered there and, like a child in a toyshop, did not know which way to
